sentences.en: Children in single-parent families must not be stigmatized.
sentences.cn: 单亲家庭的孩子不应该受到侮辱。

sentences.en: Deportation is especially hard on women from societies that stigmatize divorce.
sentences.cn: 对于那些来自视离婚为耻辱的国度的妇女来说,被驱逐出境对她们尤其艰难.

sentences.en: Single mothers often feel that they are stigmatized by society.
sentences.cn: 单身母亲常常觉得自己受社会歧视。

sentences.en: They stigmatize these propositions as " trifling " or " merely verbal ".
sentences.cn: 他们把这些命题贬称为 “ 琐碎 ” 或 “ 只是咬文嚼字罢了 ”.
他们把这些命题贬称 “ 琐碎”.

sentences.en: They wanted to stigmatize the adulteress.
sentences.cn: 他们打算羞辱这名奸妇.

words.tran_cn: 有烙印的；丑恶的；不名誉的；气孔的；小红斑的
[植] 柱头；耻辱；污名；烙印；特征

trans.tran_en: If someone or something is stigmatized, they are unfairly regarded by many people as being bad or having something to be ashamed of
